text: فضلا من ربك ذلك هو الفوز العظيم

translations.translation: A favour from your Lord. That is the Great Victory.
By the beneficence of your Lord. This will be the great success.
as a favour from your Lord. That is the great triumph.
God will protect them from the torment of hell as a favor from your Lord. (Muhammad), this is certainly the greatest triumph.
By the munificence of your Lord; this is the great success.
As a bounty from your Lord! That will be the supreme success!
A grace from your Lord; this is the great achievement.
a bounty from thy Lord; that is the mighty triumph.
A bounty from thy Lord. That is the supreme triumph.
as an act of grace. That will be the supreme triumph.
A bounty from thy Lord. That! that is the supreme achievement.
—a grace from your Lord. That is the great success.
As a Bounty from thy Lord! that will be the supreme achievement!
As a Bounty from your Lord! That will be the supreme success!
as a bounty from your Lord. That will be the mighty triumph.
A favor from your Lord. That is the supreme salvation.
As bounty from your Lord. That is what is the great attainment.

[44:57]   a bounty from your Lord (fadlan is a verbal noun, with the sense of tafaddulan, and is in the accusative [dependent status] because of an implied [preceding] tafaddala). That is the supreme triumph.

(A bounty from thy Lord) a favour from your Lord; and it is also said this means: a gift from your Lord. (That) gift (is the Supreme Triumph) the supreme safety: they earned the Garden and became safe from the 579 Fire.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: وبالجملة: إنما أعطوا ما أعطوا { فَضْلاً مِّن رَّبِّكَ } يا أكمل الرسل وبمقتضى كرمه وجوده بلا استحقاق منهم واستجلاب بطاعاتهم { ذَلِكَ } الذي بشر الله به عباده المتقين { هُوَ ٱلْفَوْزُ ٱلْعَظِيمُ } [الدخان: 57] والفضل الجسيم، لا فوز أعظم منه وأعلى

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text: { ووقاهم } ربهم { عذابَ الجحيم فضلاً من ربك } أي: أعطوا ذلك كله عطاءً وتفضُّلا منه تعالى إذ لا يجب عليه شيء، فهو مفعول له، أو مصدر مؤكد لِما قبله، لأن قوله: { وقاهم } في معنى تفضل عليهم، { ذلك هو الفوز العظيم } الذي لا فوز وراءه إذ هو خلاص من جميع المكاره، ونيل لكل المطالب
